newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Yen takes limelight on Hungary FX futures market.
newsitem.headline: Yen takes limelight on Hungary FX futures market.

text.p: Deferred maturities in the yen dominated futures trade on the Budapest Commodity Exchange on Tuesday, accounting for over three quarters of trade as dealers anticipated a yen correction after recent weakness, dealers said.

"The market has the expectation of the (recent) dollar correction going forward to the yen," said Gabor Herczeg of LaSalle. "People probably saw today's end price as a last chance to close out positions with an additional profit for the day."
September and December shared most of the yen turnover, with September hardly moving at 162.35 forints per 100 yen and December showing a slight rise of 10 fillers to 155.90.
The only other currency to register significant trade was the September mark, which rose 48 fillers to 113.50 on the back of a strong international spot performance by the German unit.
Wednesday's central bank midday fix for the yen was 142.24 forints per 100 yen, down 23, while the mark stood at 105.31, up 19.
The Budapest Stock Exchange (BSE) forex futures market was tradeless.
